"(1.4)
The Minister shall, as appropriate, provide opportunities for public participation at the national, regional and local levels in the development of parks policy, management plans and such other matters as the Minister deems relevant
.
"(1.5) The Minister shall report to Parliament every two years on the state of the parks and progress towards establishing new parks.
. . . . .
"8.3(1)
The portions of parks specified in Schedule III are hereby designated commercial ski areas
.
"(2) The Minister may not grant a lease or license of occupation of public lands in a park, other than lands situated within a commercial ski area referred to in subsection (1), for the purpose of a commercial ski facility.
"(3) The Governor in Council may, by an order amending Schedule III, designate a portion of Banff National Park in the vicinity of Mount Norquay and in the vicinity of Sunshine Village Ski Area a commercial ski area, but that Schedule is not subject to subsequent amendment by the Governor in Council." (Emphasis added)
"4. The parks are created for the benefit of the Canadian people so that they can use them for their pleasure and the enrichment of their knowledge, within the framework of this Act and its regulations;
they must be maintained and used in such a way that they remain intact for future generations
.
. . . . .
"5(1) Subject to section 8.2,
the parks are placed under the authority of the minister
(1.1) Within five years of the proclamation creating a park under a federal law, the Minister shall cause to be laid before each house of Parliament a management plan for the park with respect to the protection of resources, zoning, terms of use by visitors and any other matter he considers appropriate.
"(1.2)
When it comes to park zoning and visitor use, the primary priority is to preserve ecological integrity and, to that end, protect natural resources.
.
"(1.3) The Minister shall review the management plan for each park every five years and have it tabled - with amendments, if any - before each House of Parliament.
"(1.4)
The Minister promotes, in the indicated cases, public participation, at the national, regional and local levels, in the development of park management policy and plans as well as other measures that he considers useful.
"(1.5) Every two years, the Minister reports to Parliament on the situation of the parks and on the measures taken with a view to the creation of parks.
. . . . .
"8.3(1)
The areas mentioned in Annex III constitute commercial ski resorts
.
"(2) The Minister may not grant leases or occupation permits for other commercial ski facilities.
"(3) The Governor in Council may, by order, amend Schedule III once to add the boundaries of the Mount Norquay Ski Resort and Sunshine Village, Banff National Park." (emphasis mine)

[23]
Section 8.2 of the
Act
, referred to in s. 5(1), is not relevant for the purposes of this matter. All of the Applicants' commercial ski areas are specified in Schedule III to the
National Parks Act
and are therefore designated as commercial ski areas. While s. 7 of the
National Parks Act
provides a very broad regulation making authority, counsel before me assured me that no regulations enacted under that authority are directly relevant for the purpose of this application for judicial review.

[24]
The following provisions of the
Canadian Environmental Assessment Act
[see footnote 11] are relevant for the purposes of this judicial review.
"WHEREAS the Government of Canada seeks to achieve sustainable development by conserving and enhancing environmental quality and by encouraging and promoting economic development that conserves and enhances environmental quality;
"WHEREAS environmental assessment provides an effective means of integrating environmental factors into planning and decision-making processes in a manner that promotes sustainable development;
"WHEREAS the Government of Canada is committed to exercising leadership within Canada and internationally in anticipating and preventing the degradation of environmental quality and at the same time ensuring that economic development is compatible with the high value Canadians place on environmental quality;
"WHEREAS the Government of Canada is committed to facilitating public participation in the environmental assessment of projects to be carried out by or with the approval or assistance of the Government of Canada and providing access to the information on which those environmental assessments are based;
"2(1) In this Act,
. . . . .

(a) a Minister of the Crown in right of Canada,
. . . . .

. . . . .

. . . . .
